text: Coronavirus is a serious public health concern. We need a realistic response and competent leadership at the helm during this crisis.

I’m supporting Kim Foxx for Cook County State's Attorney because she has taken crucial steps in her first term as Cook County State’s Attorney to reform our criminal justice system, declining to prosecute low-level offenders, and pursuing alternatives to prison, all while increasing resources to combat violent gun crimes.  As early voting gets underway today in Illinois, please consider contributing now to support Kim Foxx.
It’s time for us to hold Secretary DeVos and the Trump Administration accountable for their inexcusable failure to stand with student borrowers who were cheated by for-profit schools.
The House took an important step in the fight to stop the epidemic of youth vaping and tobacco use. The Senate should join the fight and take these products that target our kids off the market.

It has been a year since the House passed its bipartisan background checks legislation. It is unconscionable for Mitch McConnell to continue to block this life-saving legislation from a vote in the Senate.
So far, the Trump Administration’s response to coronavirus is insufficient. We need to listen to our health officials and prepare to respond to a serious outbreak in the U.S.

Congress allocated these funds for our military — not for President Trump’s border wall. It’s time for the Senate to stand up for our constitutional authority and return these crucial funds to our troops.

I commend Chicago’s Department of Public Health for their response to two cases of coronavirus in Illinois. At the federal level, we need a dramatic increase in funding to stop the spread of this disease in its tracks.
Joseph Maguire told the truth. Russia is most certainly working to sabotage our 2020 election.
One out of five adults in America are unpaid caregivers for their loved ones. I am working in the Senate to pass the Supporting America’s Caregivers and Families Act to help support them.
We must stop President Trump from selling off public lands like our Arctic for oil and gas drilling.
These budget cuts are simply unacceptable. We can’t let President Trump rob crucial funds from Peoria's Air National Guard to pay for his vanity wall on the southern border.
I’m joining my colleagues to speak out in opposition of the Trump Administration’s reckless plan to sell off America’s Arctic for oil and gas development.
We’re urging the Inspector General to expand the investigation into Rudy Giuliani. The IG must use his authority to look into allegations of improper contacts between Giuliani and the DOJ.
We cannot accept discrimination in our communities. I’m calling on the U.S. Postal Service to immediately investigate reports of discriminatory treatment toward non-English speakers.

Thank you Pastor Warren Dorris for hosting me and Jennifer Bertino-Tarrant yesterday. Great to chat about the issues that matter to the people of Will County. And thanks for IBEW Local 176 and Mike Clemmons for opening your doors, and the Will-Grundy Building Trades Council for hosting me. You can count on me to always stand with organized labor.

President Trump’s priorities? He wants to slash funding for the National Guard, including the 182 Air Guard unit in Peoria, in order to build his vanity border wall that he promised Mexico would pay for.
If we fail to #ActOnClimate, the consequences will be devastating. That’s why I’m supporting the Clean Economy Act to put us on the path toward net-zero greenhouse gas emissions by 2050.

We racked up some miles on the road yesterday. I made a stop in Kankakee to support my friend Elect Patrick Joyce in his upcoming election. Joyce is the real deal: he's a successful small business owner, farmer, and family man who, like me, is prioritizing improving and expanding health care. Later that night, I joined the Peoria IL County Democrats at their annual Presidents' Day Dinner. Illinoisans all across the state are fired up for 2020.
Today we honor the leaders who helped build the United States into the great nation it is today. Happy Presidents’ Day!
I visited Puerto Rico this week to assess the progress of the recovery efforts in the aftermath of recent natural disasters that have devastated the island and impacted millions of people.
I’m introducing the Gun Records Restoration and Preservation Act to collect, preserve, and disclose gun records and tracing data. We must do everything we can to keep our families safe.

Great morning on the northwest side of Chicago yesterday. I sat down to catch up with Samantha Nugent for 39th Ward Alderman and John D'Amico for State Representative at Edens Restaurant. Later, I went door knocking with a few of my friends. Thanks to the 38th Ward Democrats & 39th Ward Dems and Friends for Frank Avino Jr. for organizing. Proud to be out supporting Robert Martwick, Lindsey LaPointe for State Representative - 19th District, and Mike Cabonargi for Clerk of the Circuit Courts in their campaigns.
I am joining all of my Democratic colleagues on the Judiciary Committee calling on Chairman Lindsey Graham to open investigations into political interference at the Department of Justice.
As a proud supporter of the Equal Rights Amendment, I am pleased to see the House vote to remove the deadline — because equality can’t wait. The Senate must do the same. #ERANow
Why is the USDA playing favorites when it comes to helping farmers who are suffering from the impacts of President Trump’s trade war? Illinois’ soybean farmers should not be shortchanged.
I am proud to help introduce the Clean Economy Act, which will help put our country on track to achieve net-zero greenhouse gas emissions by 2050 or sooner. It’s time to #ActOnClimate.
Now that Senate Republicans have acquitted President Trump, he will keep trying to engage with foreign countries to boost his re-election bid. We must stay vigilant and fight back.

President Trump’s budget proposal is unforgivable. Instead of helping working class Americans and people with pre-existing conditions, he’s asking for billions for his border wall and slashing critical programs like Medicare, Medicaid, and Social Security.
We must keep up the fight to reverse President Trump’s cruel changes to the SNAP program. These rules simply make it harder for families to put food on the table.

With two known cases of coronavirus in Illinois, I am staying in close contact with the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention to ensure we’re protecting public health here and across the country.

Big day on the road in Illinois yesterday. It was great to join Kim Foxx for Cook County State's Attorney, Rep. Kam Buckner, and Alderman Sophia King. First stops of the day included West Point Baptist Church and later Life Center COGIC, where the topic of the day was criminal justice reform. Cook County State's Attorney Kim Foxx has made criminal justice reform her priority, and she has succeeded. Additionally, under Kim Foxx's tenure, the violent crime rate in Cook County has lowered 20 percent since she has been in office. This is not an accident, it’s because of her reform measures. Later that afternoon, I headed up to to see the Democratic Party of Evanston. I am honored to have their support this election, and it was great to be joined my friend Mike Cabonargi for Clerk of the Circuit Courts. Mike is the reformer we need -- I know this from his work as an attorney at the SEC fighting fraud and corruption, and from his time working for me. He's the best person for the job.
I’ve been working to protect 5,200 miles of Great Lakes shoreline from the impacts of climate change, but the Trump Administration has dragged its feet for the past two years. Unacceptable.

Great start to the morning campaigning in Aurora with my friends State Representative Barbara Hernandez (Friends of Barbara Hernandez), Senator Linda Holmes, Congressman Bill Foster, and Mark Guethle with Painters District Council No. 30. We're fired up for the March 17, 2020 Democratic primary election in Illinois!

There’s no way around it — this has been a trying week for our democracy. But I’ll never stop fighting to hold President Trump accountable. Can I count on you to have my back? Make a $5 contribution now to support my campaign.
This is a low point for the U.S. Senate. Republicans chose to absolve the President for brazenly inviting foreign interference in our election and effectively gave him permission to do it again.

While President Trump continued to push for his divisive and reckless agenda during his State of the Union address last night, one thing was clearer than ever -- 2020 is a defining moment for our nation, and we must take back the White House and the Senate in November. From cruel, anti-immigrant policies to attacks on families’ health care and more, this President and his Republican enablers are turning their backs on our nation’s values and threatening the futures of hardworking families in Illinois and across the country. We need to stand together and send a clear message by soundly defeating them and their dangerous agenda at the ballot box.

Rep. Adam Schiff and the House managers presented a clear, compelling case for impeachment in the face of a volley of attacks from President Trump and the GOP. I am deeply proud of their unwavering fight for truth and justice.
I want to thank Ambassador Marie Yovanovitch for her service and dedication to our country.
Because the GOP decided to block witnesses and documents, we can’t call this a full and fair trial.
Senate Republicans think they can sweep this impeachment trial under the rug, but the American people are watching. And they will have their say this November.
I am deeply disappointed with the Senate Republicans who turned their backs on the truth. Without witnesses, we can hardly call this a full and fair trial. Our democracy deserves better.
We need a forward-thinking two-state solution that works for both Israel and Palestine. President Trump’s proposal will not help promote a lasting peace in the Middle East.
The idea that we need to rush through the impeachment trial to return to the business of the Senate is absurd. The Senate has become a legislative graveyard under Senator Mitch McConnell.
It’s not a real trial without evidence, documents, and witnesses.
Today marks 11 years since the Lilly Ledbetter Fair Pay Act was signed into law. Let’s renew our commitment to ensuring that women across the country earn equal pay for equal work.
I believe that swearing-in witnesses, under oath, is the best way for us to have an outcome in this impeachment trial that is credible across America. John Bolton must testify.
Putting a wealth test on immigrants is wrong. This is not who we are or should be as a country.
We should absolutely hear from John Bolton as a witness during this impeachment trial.
President Trump introduced his xenophobic travel ban three years ago today. This policy remains unconscionable and goes against who we are as Americans. We must reverse it.
The truth should matter above all else. I hope that at least four GOP Senators will stand on the right side of history and demand that we pursue a full and fair trial with witnesses and evidence.
With this confirmed case of coronavirus in Chicago, I am working closely with the CDC to ensure we are doing everything possible to protect our public health.
We know we can’t count on Secretary DeVos to stand with our students. That’s why I’m working to reverse her absurd rule that sides with predatory schools instead of defrauded students.
Without evidence, documents, and witnesses, we can’t call this a fair impeachment trial.
Are we going to have a fair impeachment trial — or are we going to have a cover-up?

Today marks 47 years since the Supreme Court’s decision in Roe v. Wade. It’s long past time for politicians to stop playing politics with women’s health and stand up for their reproductive rights. I will keep doing everything in my power to protect Roe and stop these dangerous GOP attacks.
A fair trial involves evidence. Evidence involves documents and witnesses. I hope that enough Republican Senators will understand: history will find you.
Ten years after the Citizens United decision, I am as dedicated as ever to reversing this disaster and putting our democracy back in the people’s hands.
"Injustice anywhere is a threat to justice everywhere..." Today, we remember Martin Luther King, Jr.’s dream of equality and his fight against injustice.
We need answers about how sexual assault claims are being handled by the Illinois Army Reserve. Survivors of sexual assault should be supported, not ignored or retaliated against.
Great to see the House vote to overturn Secretary DeVos’ harmful “borrower defense” rule. It’s time for the Senate to do the same and stand with students, not predatory, for-profit schools.
I hope that all Senators on both sides of the aisle will put aside partisanship and uphold our constitutional duty to pursue truth and impartial justice during this impeachment trial.
The Senate came together across party lines to stand with farmers, workers, and business and pass the USMCA. This is an important agreement for Illinois’ economic future.
The American people deserve a full and fair impeachment trial with witnesses and documents — not a cover-up.
President Trump just sent thousands of troops to the Middle East and now he wants to divert even more funds from the military to pay for his border wall? This is unacceptable.

These changes to the SNAP program are cruel and unnecessary. The only thing this will accomplish is to make it harder for families to put food on the table.Hey friends, help me share this pleeeeaaase!
President Trump’s claims to support protections for pre-existing conditions are absurd when he is shamefully working to overturn the ACA and put health care in peril for millions of Americans.
We need to meet the recent rise of hate crimes and white supremacist violence with the type of urgent action it requires. My bill will help fight back against hate crimes and domestic terrorism.
This lawsuit is threatening to overturn the Affordable Care Act and leave millions of Americans without access to the care they need. The GOP must stop playing politics with people’s health care.

It’s time for serious action to address the youth vaping epidemic. More than five million kids are now hooked on dangerous e-cigarettes. That’s why I introduced the Youth Tobacco Act to crack down on Big Vape and Big Tobacco and stop them from targeting our young people.
Instead of taking urgent action on climate change, the Trump Administration is once again rolling back critical environmental protections.
The House passed a War Powers Resolution yesterday and now it’s time for the Senate to do the same. The Constitution is clear: the power to declare war rests with Congress alone.
We all stand with the people of Puerto Rico in the wake of these devastating earthquakes.
It would be a serious mistake if we let President Trump start another endless war in the Middle East.
Our HUD Secretary should be focused on ending housing discrimination and standing up for Americans’ civil rights. Secretary Carson’s decision to reverse this rule will do the opposite.
It is time for my colleagues in Congress to take a stand. We have a constitutional responsibility to prevent further escalations and stop another reckless, endless war in the Middle East.
The fires in Australia are absolutely devastating — and a tragic look at our future if we fail to meet the climate challenge. We need real action on climate change now. #ActOnClimate
I helped introduce this resolution to stop President Trump from starting a war in Iran. Only Congress can declare war. The President cannot make this decision without authorization.
No one should live in fear of violence. It is time for Congress to support the Jewish community and take a stand against the recent rise of hateful, anti-Semitic attacks.

Only Congress has the power to declare war. We must not allow President Trump to drag us into another unauthorized, endless war in the Middle East. That’s why I filed a war powers resolution — to reassert our constitutional authority and prevent further escalations with Iran.
Wishing a Happy New Year to everyone ringing in 2020 in Illinois and all across the country!

I need you with me in the fight to win Illinois and do our part to flip the Senate in 2020. Will you donate before midnight to help us meet our crucial fundraising goal before the FEC deadline? Pitch in $5: http://bit.ly/356BvXA Pitch in $25: http://bit.ly/35anSqt Pitch in $75: http://bit.ly/2MAmVks Pitch in $100: http://bit.ly/2QrUfv9

"I have been in some kind of fight — for freedom, equality, basic human rights — for nearly my entire life." — Rep. John Lewis  Now, as Rep. Lewis takes on another fight, so many of us are standing with him and marching by his side. We are all with you, John.

In 2020, I’m committed to the fight to keep Illinois blue and take back the Senate. Are you with me? Pitch in now to support my re-election campaign before the December 31st FEC deadline. http://bit.ly/364xXpT
Alexander Hamilton said that the duty of an impeachment trial was given to the Senate because we are “independent and dignified.” We need to do our very best to meet those standards.
Congress must act to stop the gun violence that’s ripping apart families and communities.
Merry Christmas! Sending my warmest wishes to you and your loved ones today.
Wishing a Happy Hanukkah to families in Illinois and all across the nation!
I was on WGN radio this week to discuss critically important issues for Illinois families like the opioid crisis and paid family leave.
I’m glad that we were able to come together to fund the government — including our troops, the CDC, and protections for the Great Lakes region — and avoid another disastrous shutdown.
I hope that four Republican Senators will do the right thing and stand up for our constitutional responsibility to conduct a fair impeachment trial based on the evidence.

With the Fifth Circuit’s decision overturning part of the Affordable Care Act yesterday, we just got a stark reminder that the health care fight isn’t over -- and if the Republicans get their way, Illinoisans and people across this country are at risk of losing their health insurance.

I introduced the Family Medical Leave Modernization Act because we need to improve FMLA to better meet the needs of families today. Family members like grandparents, siblings, or adult children shouldn’t have to choose between losing their job or caring for their loved one.
We need four Republican Senators to stand up for a real impeachment trial in the Senate where we carefully consider the evidence. This is our constitutional responsibility.
A new report shows that Fortune 500 companies paid an average tax rate of only 11.3% in 2018 — and 91 companies paid no federal taxes at all — thanks to the Trump-GOP tax scam.
Can the Senate pursue justice in an impartial way if many Republican Senators have already made a decision on the impeachment proceedings before the trial has even begun?

President Trump’s conspiracy theories claiming the Russia investigation was unfair or biased are ridiculous. It’s time for him to accept that Russians interfered in our election and endangered our democracy -- and are gearing up to do it again in 2020. Add your name if you agree.
I agree with Houston Police Chief Acevedo. It’s disturbing that Republicans in the Senate are so beholden to the NRA that they’re refusing to reauthorize the Violence Against Women Act.
I’m afraid that Attorney General Barr has become a partisan political tool for President Trump.
We can’t accept Congressional Republicans’ climate denial or delay. We must #ActOnClimate now.
After working to interfere in our 2016 election and planning to do the same in 2020, the Russians should be sanctioned—not welcomed to the White House with open arms.
The Inspector General’s nonpartisan report confirms that the Russia investigation was not influenced by political bias against President Trump, despite what the President may claim.
White supremacy has no place in our country, and especially not in the White House. Stephen Miller is unfit to serve in any capacity and President Trump must remove him immediately.
The U.S. continues to stand with the people of Hong Kong in their fight for democracy.
In our democracy, there is nothing more sacred than the right to vote. We must fiercely protect this fundamental right from attacks. It’s time to come together and #RestoreTheVote.
Leader McConnell and the GOP have shown that they will obstruct any and all progress the House makes for the American people. We must take back the Senate.
Today is National Pearl Harbor Remembrance Day, a time for reflection on the tragic events of December 7, 1941. We will always remember and hold in our hearts the souls we lost that day.
We need urgent action to curb the e-cigarette public health crisis and the threat it poses to young people across the country. President Trump: put our kids’ health first, not Big Vape.
No one should be forced to live in fear with the rising threat of hate crimes in our communities. I’m proud to join my colleagues to introduce legislation that addresses this troubling trend.

Looking for holiday gifts for the Democrats on your list? My online merch store is officially up and running with t-shirts, sweatshirts, bumper stickers, buttons, and more. Support my re-election campaign and get your 2020 gear now: https://store.durbinforsenate.com/
Speaker Pelosi is right. The U.S. must — and with Democratic leadership, will — honor our commitment to fighting the existential threat that climate change poses to our planet.
Thousands of people chose to go into public service professions with the promise of student debt relief. It’s unacceptable that Secretary DeVos is failing to meet this basic commitment.
It’s critically important that parents know the gifts they buy this holiday season are not dangerous. I’m calling on the Consumer Product Safety Commission to keep our kids safe.
Happy Thanksgiving to everyone gathering in gratitude and celebration today in Illinois and across the country. We have much to be thankful for—and so much more we can do to help others.
It’s time for Republicans to join Democrats and act on climate.
Thank you to my incredible supporters in Illinois for helping me secure my spot on the ballot. I am proud to fight for you every day -- and I'm ready to keep fighting in 2020 and beyond.

Filing petitions to officially put my name on the ballot for re-election in 2020. We all have a part to play in the fights ahead: keeping Illinois blue, flipping the Senate, and defeating President Trump. I am ready for the fight.

Today, I am officially filing the paperwork for my 2020 re-election campaign. I need your support because it has never been more important to keep Illinois blue and help Democrats take back the Senate. Can I count on you in this fight? Pitch in now to help me launch this campaign.
Proud to join Kamala Harris and Tammy Duckworth to introduce the Housing is Infrastructure Act to help ensure every American has access to a safe, healthy place to live.
I joined Jeff Merkley to introduce the Protecting Students from Worthless Degrees Act so students and taxpayers will not be forced to pay for predatory, for-profit programs.
I met with President Trump’s FDA nominee, Stephen Hahn, and told him that we need urgent action on the vaping crisis. With lives at risk, there is no excuse for the Administration’s delay.
Now that we’ve passed this continuing resolution, the Senate needs to come together and put our appropriations back on track. We must avoid another disastrous shutdown in December.
More than $35 million in aid to Ukraine still hasn’t been released -- and we need to know why.
Outrageous. I am fighting in the Senate to rein in Big Pharma’s greed and to pass legislation that puts a stop to the exorbitant price hikes on insulin, a life-saving drug for people with diabetes.
We came together to pass the First Step Act nearly a year ago, and President Trump made the right decision to sign it into law. Now, his Department of Justice is resisting its implementation.
Now that the Senate has passed the Hong Kong Human Rights and Democracy Act, we’re urging the House to take quick action to show our nation’s support for Hong Kong’s people.
It is time to reform mandatory minimum prison sentences for non-violent drug offenses. Passing the Smarter Sentencing Act is a key component in our continued fight for criminal justice reform.
This is beyond disappointing -- it’s unacceptable. The Trump Administration should be doing what’s right for our young people and families, not serving the interests of Big Vape.
We need to step up our game when it comes to scientific research. I’m fighting to pass legislation that would increase funding for top research agencies like NSF and NASA.

The Child Soldiers Prevention Act is the law of the land -- and I’m demanding answers about the Trump Administration’s compliance with this law that bans military assistance to foreign governments that use children as soldiers.
Big Vape used Big Tobacco’s playbook to get young people hooked on e-cigarettes. Now, as we face a public health crisis with 4 deaths in Illinois alone, we need serious action to fight back.
I’m joining my colleagues Cory Booker and Kamala Harris and introducing legislation to defend fundamental human rights and severely limit the use of solitary confinement in ICE facilities.

I introduced the original Dream Act back in 2001 because I strongly believed then, as I do now, that Dreamers belong here. Today, this fight is more urgent than ever. The Senate needs to pass the American Dream and Promise Act without delay to permanently protect Dreamers.
As we learn the details of another tragic school shooting, it is clearer than ever that Senate Republicans must stop blocking urgently-needed reforms to our gun laws.

Dreamers are part of the very fabric of our communities. These young people’s futures shouldn’t hang in the balance of a Supreme Court decision. The Senate must join the House right away and pass the American Dream and Promise Act to permanently protect Dreamers.

Do you want to work on campaigns? Do you dream of a chance to start or grow a career in Democratic politics? The National Democratic Training Committee’s Staff Academy trains the next generation of campaign staff and connects them to jobs on 2020 Democratic campaigns. Join their 2020 training program now.

Today, the Supreme Court heard arguments concerning President Trump’s immoral decision to end the DACA program and put nearly 800,000 Dreamers at risk of deportation from the country where they grew up and have built their lives and careers.  I’ve been fighting to protect Dreamers for nearly 19 years -- and though the Senate has yet to pass the Dream Act, DACA offers a beacon of hope for these young people. It’s shameful that the Trump Administration would end this program and put so many people’s lives in limbo. We need you in this fight. Share this video now if you’re standing with Dreamers today.
To every veteran in Illinois and all over this country, thank you. As Americans, we are all thankful for your extraordinary service and dedication to our nation. #VeteransDay
We know Democrats have a path to taking back the Senate, but we also know this fight won’t be easy. It’s going to take all of us standing together and fighting for a Democratic majority in 2020.
No one should ever be forced to ration insulin or choose between medicine and groceries. Proud to join my colleague Jeff Merkley in the fight to protect patients from price-gouging.
The Constitution is clear. If the House of Representatives reports articles of impeachment, it’s the Senate’s very important and serious role to serve as the jury.

Nearly 200 countries came together to address climate change, but because of President Trump’s dangerous actions, the U.S. is now the only country to pull out of the agreement. The fight to address the catastrophic impacts of climate change can’t wait. If you oppose President Trump’s withdrawal from the Paris Climate Agreement, now is the time to stand up and be counted. Add your name to join the fight.
I am fighting to protect Dreamers, whose contributions make our country stronger. The Supreme Court must make the right decision and reverse President Trump’s attacks on DACA.
There is a clear connection between the tragic opioid epidemic and the extremely high amounts of opioids that are approved for production. It’s time for the DEA to step in and do its job.
We know that our elections are under attack and our democracy is at stake — but Majority Leader Mitch McConnell still refuses to hold a vote on election security. Unacceptable.
It’s time for Leader McConnell and the GOP to stand up to China and support democracy for the people of Hong Kong. Let’s pass the Hong Kong Human Rights and Democracy Act now.
By turning his back on science and the global consensus for urgent climate action, President Trump is tarnishing our standing on the world stage and putting our planet’s future at risk.
This is outrageous. Instead of making the federal tax code work for working families, the Trump Administration is focused on making it easier for corporations to avoid paying their fair share.
Great time yesterday at the Plumbers Local 130 annual football raffle. Always good to spend time with Illinois Pipe Trades Association members.
The Trump Administration and Republicans are still attacking the Affordable Care Act in court, and health care coverage hangs in the balance for millions of people across the country.
We need real solutions to the gun violence epidemic -- not President Trump’s empty promises.
The Democratic House has already passed more than 200 pieces of legislation -- but Mitch McConnell is just letting these bills sit on his desk. It’s time for a Democratic Senate.

Once again, the GOP turned their backs on everyone in this country with a pre-existing condition. Make no mistake -- Senate Democrats will keep fighting to stop the Trump Administration’s “junk insurance” plans that discriminate against millions of Americans.
Millions of our children have been hooked on dangerous nicotine products because of flavored e-cigarettes. The Trump Administration must follow through and take action to keep kids safe.
If Republicans care about people with pre-existing conditions, this is their chance to prove it.
President Trump should be ashamed. He sings Russia’s praises, but attacks the great American city of Chicago. This is beneath the dignity of the President of the United States.
No one, including Secretary DeVos, is above the law. That’s why she was fined $100,000 and held in contempt for her refusal to stand with our students instead of greedy, for-profit colleges.
Attorney General Barr must recuse himself from all matters related to this investigation.

The Trump Administration is continuing its attacks on Americans’ health care by promoting short-term junk insurance plans that discriminate against people with pre-existing conditions. These reckless actions from President Trump and the GOP are putting access to affordable health care in jeopardy for millions of people in Illinois and all over this country.  I’m joining Senate Democrats and fighting back to protect people with pre-existing conditions, but we need you in the fight. Add your name now to show your support.
We have had enough of the obstruction from Majority Leader McConnell and Senate Republicans. It’s time to hold a vote to protect our elections and defend our democracy.
President Trump is endangering our democracy and damaging our credibility around the world. It’s past time for my GOP colleagues to find the courage to speak up and do something about it.

When President Trump and the Republicans pushed their tax bill through Congress, they promised tax relief for middle class families. Then, the exact opposite happened: new analysis shows that America’s richest 400 families now pay lower overall tax rates than the middle class.

President Trump isn’t serious about border security—he only cares about the ineffective border wall he promised Mexico would pay for. Now, he’s diverting money from our military and their families to build it. This is a clear abuse of power—and we all must keep speaking out and fighting back.
As Chicago reels in the wake of more gun violence this weekend, our communities are demanding action. What will it take for the Senate GOP to agree to reform our gun laws?
Due to the Trump Administration’s stunning lack of international leadership, we’re now seeing Venezuela get a spot on the Human Rights Council.
It’s a shame that Senate Republicans failed to join us and override President Trump’s veto. The Senate should be defending our Constitution, not enabling President Trump’s abuse of power.
Once again, President Trump’s shameful corruption is on full display.
The House passed the Hong Kong Human Rights and Democracy Act, and now it’s time for the Senate to stand with the people of Hong Kong in support of democracy and human rights.

Over the course of his life and career, Chairman Elijah Cummings led by example, demonstrating for all of us what it means to be a true public servant and a passionate fighter for freedom, equality, and justice for all. His memory and legacy will live on.

It was an honor joining Indo-American Democratic Organization/IADO for their 40th annual banquet this past weekend. Thank you President Ram Villivalam for the warm welcome.FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE Thursday October 17, 2019 (Washington, DC) Immigration Voice Announces Disappointment in Senator Dick Durbin’s Blockade of the Fairness...
By passing the Protecting Student Athletes from Concussions Act and adopting the ‘when in doubt, sit it out’ policy nationwide, we can increase student health and safety in youth sports.

Enjoyed meeting with members of the Schaumburg Area Democrats and the Democrats of Northfield Township this weekend for an important discussion about what’s on the line in 2020. A special thanks to Committeeperson Mike Cudzik and Committeeperson Tracy Katz Muhl for all the work they do.

Thank you to the West Side Black Elected Officials for the productive meeting, conversation, and your endorsement. I’m proud to stand with you in the fight and look forward to your support in 2020 and beyond.
No matter who ends up “leading” the Department of Homeland Security next, we sadly know what we can expect: more of President Trump’s inhumane, anti-immigrant agenda.

After our nation made the horrific mistake of turning our back on Jewish refugees during the Holocaust, we vowed not to fail this moral challenge again. Since then, the United States has been a leader in providing safe haven for refugees from around the world. But President Trump is limiting the number of refugees who can come to our country. He is betraying our American values and punishing innocent, vulnerable people and families who are fleeing violence and despair.
President Trump is doing whatever he can to obstruct the impeachment inquiry and avoid accountability for his actions. It’s time for Republicans to speak up and put our country first.
There is no question that Russia interfered in our 2016 elections. There is also no question that Leader McConnell is shamefully refusing to act to prevent it from happening again in 2020.
As a member of the Senate Judiciary Committee, I stand ready to question Rudy Giuliani. The American people deserve real answers.
Because President Trump’s actions are so serious and basic to the responsibility of a President of the United States, Congress had no choice but to open an impeachment inquiry.
Here’s what you need to know as Congress opens the impeachment inquiry of President Trump.
Our hearts break as we learn about another mass shooting. But we are not helpless when it comes to fighting the epidemic of gun violence. The Senate needs to take urgent action now.

President Trump's cruel decision to drastically limit the number of refugees admitted to the U.S. betrays our American values and punishes innocent, vulnerable people and families who are fleeing violence and despair.
I will keep fighting as long as it takes to fully protect these young people from being sent away from the only home they’ve ever known. We must do everything we can to protect Dreamers.
The Trump Administration’s immoral decision to slash the number of refugees allowed to come to our country is a shameful abdication of our nation’s core values.
As the original sponsor of the Dream Act, I have been proudly standing with Dreamers since 2001. It’s time for the Senate to join the House and pass the American Dream and Promise Act.
As the Trump Administration continues its assault on the Affordable Care Act, I am helping to lead the fight to protect the millions of people who are living with pre-existing conditions.

There’s no path to a Senate majority if we don’t win right here in Illinois. I’m up against a huge FEC deadline and need you to show your support for my campaign now more than ever. The Senate voted to block President Trump from declaring his ineffective border wall a “national emergency” so he can divert billions of dollars from our military—but we need more Republicans to take a stand and put a stop to this outrageous abuse of power.

While Mitch McConnell and President Trump ignore this crisis, communities in Illinois and across the nation are being devastated by the gun violence epidemic. The House has already passed a universal background checks bill—now the Senate must do the same.

There is no excuse for inaction from the FDA as the vaping crisis continues to grow out of control. The CDC just reported that there have now been at least 12 deaths and 805 serious lung illnesses related to vaping.
This is the second time in six months that the Senate has come together in a bipartisan way to vote to overturn President Trump’s absurd national emergency over his beloved border wall.

Today, I am calling on the House of Representatives to begin a formal impeachment inquiry of President Donald Trump. President Trump himself admitted that, while on a phone call with the President of Ukraine, he sought damaging information about his possible future opponent, former Vice President Joe Biden, while at the same time he was withholding $250 million worth of U.S. military aid for Ukraine as a bargaining chip. By any reasonable standard, these actions are out of step with our laws and our values. The Trump Administration has repeatedly refused to comply with Congressional subpoenas, meaning the only way we can truly move forward with this critically important investigation is by opening an impeachment inquiry. It’s now up to Congress to act under our constitutional authority and begin an impeachment inquiry because the American people deserve answers about President Trump’s abuse of power and potentially illegal actions. I didn’t come to this decision lightly—but defending our democracy and our nation’s values against this reckless President’s actions has never been more essential than it is now.

We need immediate action to stop the gun violence plaguing Chicago and so many communities across the U.S. It’s time for the GOP to stop standing in the way of commonsense gun safety reforms like universal background checks.
It’s deeply disturbing that Secretary DeVos and the Trump Administration continue to side with greedy for-profit colleges at the expense of our students.
With illnesses and deaths reported around the country, I’m calling on the FDA to pull pod and cartridge-based e-cigarettes from the market while we investigate the cause of this crisis.
I stand with the young people in Illinois and all over the world who are fighting for their futures with today’s Climate Strike. We truly have no time to waste. We need action on climate change now.
President Trump promised Mexico would pay for his ineffective border wall, so why is he now diverting the funds for his border wall from our military members and families?
Senate Democrats are doing everything we can to pass universal background checks because we know that peoples’ lives are on the line. #BackgroundChecksNow

The Democratic House did their job—they passed a bill that requires background checks for every gun purchase in the country. Now it’s time for the Senate to act. Add your name to join us in calling on Leader McConnell to stop standing in the way and bring this bill to the Senate floor for a vote.

Students already face enough costs and barriers to entry when it comes to college education. That’s why I’m sponsoring the Affordable College Textbook Act in the Senate to help students save millions of dollars on college textbooks.
The American people understand that commonsense gun safety reform will keep our families safe and save countless innocent lives. When will Republicans decide to take action?

First, President Trump abused his power by ignoring Congress and declaring a false national emergency in order to fund his ineffective wall on our southern border. Now, he is robbing funds designated for crucial military projects across the country. We cannot allow this to stand. Congress and the American people have rejected President Trump’s wall. Enough is enough. Add your name now to join me in the fight to stop President Trump’s outrageous abuse of power as he diverts funding from our armed forces to fund his ineffective border wall.

The Trump Administration’s decision not to grant Temporary Protected Status to Bahamians in their time of need after Hurricane Dorian is cruel and heartless, but not surprising. I am introducing the Bahamas Temporary Protected Status of 2019 to ensure we stand with our Bahamian neighbors and offer humanitarian support during this time of grief and devastation.

This is long overdue, but welcome action from the FDA and the Trump Administration. Big Vape should not be allowed to target children and young people with e-cigarette flavors like Unicorn Milk and Gummy Bears.

I’m working in the Senate to reverse President Trump’s abuse of power as he robs military funds to pay for his ineffective border wall. We can’t let him use his false declaration of a national emergency to subvert the will of Congress and the American people.
Today, we pause to remember the thousands of innocent lives that were lost on September 11, 2001, in New York City, Pennsylvania, and Washington D.C. We will never forget.

We have a youth vaping epidemic, and young people are being exposed to dangerous, even deadly, e-cigarettes. Acting FDA Commissioner Ned Sharpless must do his job and enforce regulations on Big Vape now—or resign.
This should not be a partisan issue—in fact, the overwhelming majority of Americans agree that we should expand background checks for gun purchases. We must take action to save lives.
Great to celebrate Rep. Danny Davis' birthday this weekend and help him kick off his re-election campaign!
Great to be in Little Village for the 50th Annual 26th Street Mexican Independence Day Parade!
The American people should not be forced to foot the bill twice for crucial projects for our military because President Trump stole the money to fulfill his vanity project on the southern border.
We must ensure those battling the opioid epidemic have the resources they need. I am proud to have helped secure this important investment for the opioid response program in Illinois.
President Trump’s decision to end medical deferrals for immigrants—effectively opening the door to deporting kids with cancer—is immoral and wrong. It seems that cruelty is the point.
Rural areas in Illinois and all over the country are struggling with a shortage of doctors and health care providers. I’m introducing new legislation that will help solve this problem.
We all remember President Trump’s empty promise that Mexico would pay for his vanity project border wall. Instead, he has decided to steal the funds from our troops and their families.

President Trump made the unconscionable decision to end DACA two years ago today, forcing Dreamers to live with the uncertainty and fear of being deported from the only country they’ve ever known. We must pass the American Dream and Promise Act now. #ProtectDreamers
This is indefensible. Secretary DeVos and the Trump Administration are once again standing with shady, for-profit colleges and turning their backs on students who were cheated by them.
As our nation faces the aftermath of yet another devastating mass shooting, it’s time for the Senate to take urgent action to stop this epidemic. No more excuses—this must be our top priority.
My thoughts are with the Bahamian people and with everyone in the path of Hurricane Dorian.
Happy Labor Day! Great to spend the day with LIUNA Laborers' Local 362 & IBEW 146, celebrating hardworking Illinoisans and continuing to fight for workers' rights.
Happy Labor Day! Today, we say thank you to the workers in Illinois and all over the country.
President Trump shouldn’t ignore our laws to help his Russian friends. I am strongly denouncing the President’s shortsighted decision to suspend military aid to Ukraine.
I am demanding the Trump Administration reverse its inhumane Remain in Mexico policy now. This short-sighted policy will only further destabilize border cities and exacerbate the crisis.
Another weekend of gun violence leaves even more families grieving in Chicago. How long will Republican leaders refuse to enact commonsense gun reform to keep our families safe?
The Amazon Rainforest fires are devastating one of our planet’s most precious natural resources. I am standing with the people of Brazil as they work to fight these flames.
If our communities aren’t fairly and accurately counted in the Census, states like Illinois will lose at least $1,800 in federal funding for each uncounted person—every year for the next ten years.
This weekend, I proudly stood with the Rohingya community to raise awareness of the ongoing campaign of horrific violence and ethnic cleansing by the Burmese government in Myanmar.
President Trump and the GOP must stop blocking TPS for Venezuelans who are already living in the United States. This cold-hearted inaction is putting innocent families’ lives in danger.
We are already feeling the impact of climate change and it’s nothing short of devastating. We must make this global emergency a top priority and take immediate action. #ActOnClimate
Not only are e-cigarette companies like JUUL addicting a new generation to their products, it’s now clear that they are exposing them to serious and unknown health dangers as well.
Americans are pestered with millions of illegal robocalls every year. That’s why I am working in Congress to crack down on these scam artists and stop unwanted robocalls in their tracks.
The Trump Administration is continuing its dangerous anti-immigrant agenda with this outrageous attempt to allow migrant families at our border to be detained indefinitely.
People in Chicago and across the U.S. are calling for commonsense gun reform. It is time for the Senate to take action to address the gun violence epidemic and help keep our families safe.
I am proud to partner with Tammy Duckworth on this initiative to invest in our communities by empowering small businesses, especially those owned by women, veterans, and minorities.
The conditions at Homestead do not meet minimum standards required by both U.S. and international law. We cannot allow the Trump Administration to send more children there.
For police officers and for members of the public, reforming our gun laws must be a top priority. We owe it to the American people to take meaningful action to keep them safe and save lives.
We have no time to waste when it comes to fighting the climate crisis. We must #ActOnClimate.
We cannot continue to allow dangerous people to get their hands on deadly firearms. I agree with the Mayor of Philadelphia—it’s time for commonsense gun reform to save countless lives.
We need commonsense gun reforms that will help avoid tragedies and save lives. My SECURE Firearm Storage Act would help to prevent violence perpetrated with stolen guns.
Once again, President Trump is pushing his anti-immigrant agenda. This won’t solve the border crisis, it will only create fear.
We must do everything we can to ensure a fair and accurate Census that counts everyone.
Farmers in Illinois and across the nation have been the first casualties of President Trump’s misguided and ineffective trade war with China. I’m committed to helping them any way that I can.
Novartis' AveXis provides yet another example of Big Pharma’s dangerous greed. We must hold Big Pharma accountable for manipulating data and potentially putting patients in harm’s way.
I’m working to pass the America Grows Act and increase funding for much-needed agricultural research. We can’t leave these priorities to China. America must continue to lead on agriculture.
White supremacist violence poses extreme and serious threats to our country. I am urging our government to give the investigations into these threats the level of intensity they deserve.
My colleague Tammy Duckworth and I are calling on the MLB to make fan safety a top priority.
Leader McConnell: call the Senate back in session. The time to vote on gun reform is now.

We have had enough of living in constant fear of gun violence, and we have had enough of Republican politicians standing with the gun lobby and the NRA instead of taking action on commonsense gun reform to save countless American lives. It is time for action. Enough is enough.
I am calling on the Senate to pass my Domestic Terrorism Prevention Act right away. We have a moral obligation to do everything we can to fight this scourge of white supremacist violence.

After a shooter motivated by hatred and white supremacy opened fire at a Walmart yesterday in El Paso, Texas, murdering 20 people and leaving dozens more injured, today we woke to news of another shooting in Dayton, Ohio, where nine people were killed and 26 injured. Enough is enough. Our nation is plagued by gun violence and we need action now. We must pass commonsense gun reform and save countless American lives.

The budget deal we passed in the Senate isn’t perfect, but it allows us to invest in the crucial programs that so many Americans rely on and avoid another costly government shutdown.FOLLOW UP TO ALL WHO WANT TO KNOW ABOUT WIRELESS FREQUENCIES, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO 5G:  IN NY STATE, 5G is already underway.  The FCC is now buying out...
It’s appalling that Chairman Graham and his fellow Republicans on the Judiciary Committee have decided to toss aside long-standing rules to push through their cruel immigration agenda.

The death penalty is a deeply flawed form of punishment that is disproportionately carried out on minorities and people of color. It is time to abolish the death penalty at the federal level.In case you forgot, this is Polly Klaas (13yrs old) and her dad Marc Klaas. In 1993, she  was kidnapped during a slumber party raped and killed. This POS...
When Democrats take back the Senate, we will pass a constitutional amendment to get big money out of politics and return our democracy to the American people. #DemocracyForAll

Today, I called for the Senate to pass Temporary Protected Status for the 200,000 Venezuelans currently living in the United States. We cannot turn our backs on these families. Unfortunately, Senate Republicans objected.
With the knowledge that the Russians are intent on interfering in our 2020 presidential election, it’s imperative that we do everything possible to protect our elections and defend our democracy.
We can disagree about immigration policy, but we should all be able to agree that children should be treated with compassion at our border. The cruelty has to be stopped.
President Trump: cutting food stamps for millions of Americans is cruel and heartless. Our political leaders should be helping families make ends meet—not making it harder.
Youth e-cigarette use has grown into a public health epidemic. The Acting FDA Commissioner must take action to protect our children—not tobacco companies and e-cigarette manufacturers.
Nearly two thousand people are injured by foul balls every season. I am calling on MLB Commissioner Manfred and all teams to extend safety netting at all ballparks to the foul poles.
We need urgent action to protect our elections, but Leader McConnell is still standing in the way. Add your name now to urge Leader McConnell to bring election security legislation to a vote.
We must take seriously the threat of white supremacist violence and domestic terrorism.
The Russians interfered in our elections in 2016 and we now know they are determined to do it again in 2020. Mitch McConnell needs to stop standing in the way of protecting our elections.
How could the DEA approve ever-increasing quotas and then wonder why the opioid epidemic was growing out of control? It’s up to our government to rein in Big Pharma’s greed.
Thousands have now been released from prison because of the historic criminal justice reform I helped pass. I’ll keep working to ensure the First Step Act is fully and fairly implemented.

On Friday, I joined a delegation of Democratic Senators visiting the southern border to witness firsthand the inhumane conditions at detention facilities for migrant children and families. This is not the America we know and love. President Trump’s cruel policies must be stopped.
The impact of the new asylum rules for our southern border are already being felt by thousands of asylum-seekers attempting to flee violence and persecution.
If President Trump was really interested in solutions for the crisis at our southern border, he would stop creating new ones. The cruelty is the point.

The Trump Administration has made a habit of running headfirst into awful immigration policy with little to no preparation. When they did this with family separation, the results were devastating. The hasty and ill-conceived decision to deny asylum requests at our southern border will be more of the same.
A young student named Guadalupe broke down into tears as she handed me a letter about how she is living in fear of losing her mother and father. We must end these abhorrent policies now.
The President telling four Congresswomen of color to “go back” to where they came from is not only repulsive and hateful—it’s racist. All of us—Democrats and Republicans—must denounce this.
President Trump’s cruel, anti-immigrant agenda is causing families in Chicago and in cities around the country to live in fear. We must put a stop to this Administration’s inhumanity.
No one should be forced to ration life-saving drugs like insulin because they can’t afford the price tag. The Senate must stand with patients and ensure they can access affordable insulin.
At the same time that President Trump’s family separation policy is creating a humanitarian crisis on the border, he’s now shamefully planning to separate families across the country.
Mass arrests and deportations won’t make our country safer—they will tear apart families and drive fear in our communities. President Trump must reverse his cruel, anti-immigrant agenda.
I stood with Senate Democratic leaders and helped introduce the Stop Cruelty to Migrant Children Act to end family separation and the unacceptable conditions at our southern border.
I am proud to stand with our U.S. Women’s National Team in the fight for equal pay.
I am joining the call for Labor Secretary Alex Acosta’s immediate resignation.
President Trump is once again considering a citizenship question on the 2020 Census. This is a deliberate attempt to undercount our communities and hurt states like Illinois in the process.
Today, the Trump Administration is in court yet again shamefully trying to rip away affordable health care from people with pre-existing conditions and millions more across the country.
So proud of our U.S. Women’s National Team. Congrats to the World Cup champs!

Oral arguments in the Trump Administration’s lawsuit against the Affordable Care Act are expected to begin on Tuesday—and health care coverage for millions of people across America hangs in the balance.
Election interference by Russia is no joke. We must act to protect the integrity of our democracy.
The conditions at these facilities are abhorrent. I saw the cruelty firsthand when I visited the border. As Americans, we must demand better from our country than this.
Happy Independence Day to Illinoisans and Americans all across this nation.
I’m glad that the Trump Administration is moving forward on the 2020 Census without its politically-motivated citizenship question. A fair and accurate Census is essential for our democracy.
While it’s not surprising that Secretary DeVos is choosing to side with greedy, for-profit colleges instead of our students, that doesn’t make it any less reprehensible.
The Senate must stand with Dreamers and pass the American Dream and Promise Act now.

I need you to do something before midnight tonight. We have a real shot at ending Leader McConnell’s and the Republican Party’s control of the Senate. If we do, we can put the Senate back to work for the American people. Make a gift before tonight’s FEC deadline to help turn the Senate blue in 2020! At a meeting yesterday with Vladimir Putin, a reporter asked President Trump whether he’ll tell Russia to stop interfering in American elections. President Trump responded by jokingly looking at Putin and saying “Don’t meddle in the election.”  President Trump: election interference by Russia is no joke. It’s time we take decisive action to protect the integrity of our democracy.
I’m encouraged that the Supreme Court saw the Trump Administration’s citizenship question for what it was: an attempt to undercount our communities and subvert our democratic process.
Let’s be clear: only Congress has the power to declare war. We must have a debate and vote in the Senate, and not allow the President to rush us into a disastrous conflict with Iran.
President Trump’s inhumane immigration policies have led to the humanitarian crisis we’re seeing on our southern border. This is one of the most shameful chapters of our history.
With the future of our planet at risk, the Trump Administration is sweeping the results of dozens of government-funded studies under the rug to hide the dangers posed by climate change.
It’s beyond shameful that we have a President who uses children as bargaining chips, threatening to deport millions if Congress won’t allow him to continue his inhumane agenda.
From the Saudi-led humanitarian disaster in Yemen to the brutal killing of journalist Jamal Khashoggi, President Trump should be standing up to Saudi Arabia, not selling them weapons.
This is dangerous. President Trump must not rush us into another reckless war in the Middle East.
President Trump’s sinister promise of mass arrests and deportations of undocumented immigrants is not the answer to solving this crisis. We need comprehensive immigration reform.

"I have been in some kind of fight — for freedom, equality, basic human rights — for nearly my entire life." — Rep. John Lewis  Now, as Rep. Lewis takes on another fight, so many of us are standing with him and marching by his side. We are all with you, John.
Wishing a Happy Hanukkah to families in Illinois and all across the nation!
I agree with Houston Police Chief Acevedo. It’s disturbing that Republicans in the Senate are so beholden to the NRA that they’re refusing to reauthorize the Violence Against Women Act.
We can’t accept Congressional Republicans’ climate denial or delay. We must #ActOnClimate now.
It’s critically important that parents know the gifts they buy this holiday season are not dangerous. I’m calling on the Consumer Product Safety Commission to keep our kids safe.
Thank you to my incredible supporters in Illinois for helping me secure my spot on the ballot. I am proud to fight for you every day -- and I'm ready to keep fighting in 2020 and beyond.
We came together to pass the First Step Act nearly a year ago, and President Trump made the right decision to sign it into law. Now, his Department of Justice is resisting its implementation.
We know Democrats have a path to taking back the Senate, but we also know this fight won’t be easy. It’s going to take all of us standing together and fighting for a Democratic majority in 2020.
It’s time for Leader McConnell and the GOP to stand up to China and support democracy for the people of Hong Kong. Let’s pass the Hong Kong Human Rights and Democracy Act now.

The Trump Administration is continuing its attacks on Americans’ health care by promoting short-term junk insurance plans that discriminate against people with pre-existing conditions. These reckless actions from President Trump and the GOP are putting access to affordable health care in jeopardy for millions of people in Illinois and all over this country.  I’m joining Senate Democrats and fighting back to protect people with pre-existing conditions, but we need you in the fight. Add your name now to show your support.
We have had enough of the obstruction from Majority Leader McConnell and Senate Republicans. It’s time to hold a vote to protect our elections and defend our democracy.

When President Trump and the Republicans pushed their tax bill through Congress, they promised tax relief for middle class families. Then, the exact opposite happened: new analysis shows that America’s richest 400 families now pay lower overall tax rates than the middle class.
Once again, President Trump’s shameful corruption is on full display.
By passing the Protecting Student Athletes from Concussions Act and adopting the ‘when in doubt, sit it out’ policy nationwide, we can increase student health and safety in youth sports.

Thank you to the West Side Black Elected Officials for the productive meeting, conversation, and your endorsement. I’m proud to stand with you in the fight and look forward to your support in 2020 and beyond.

After our nation made the horrific mistake of turning our back on Jewish refugees during the Holocaust, we vowed not to fail this moral challenge again. Since then, the United States has been a leader in providing safe haven for refugees from around the world. But President Trump is limiting the number of refugees who can come to our country. He is betraying our American values and punishing innocent, vulnerable people and families who are fleeing violence and despair.
The Trump Administration’s immoral decision to slash the number of refugees allowed to come to our country is a shameful abdication of our nation’s core values.
President Trump promised Mexico would pay for his ineffective border wall, so why is he now diverting the funds for his border wall from our military members and families?
Senate Democrats are doing everything we can to pass universal background checks because we know that peoples’ lives are on the line. #BackgroundChecksNow

I’m working in the Senate to reverse President Trump’s abuse of power as he robs military funds to pay for his ineffective border wall. We can’t let him use his false declaration of a national emergency to subvert the will of Congress and the American people.
Today, we pause to remember the thousands of innocent lives that were lost on September 11, 2001, in New York City, Pennsylvania, and Washington D.C. We will never forget.

I am proud to partner with Tammy Duckworth on this initiative to invest in our communities by empowering small businesses, especially those owned by women, veterans, and minorities.
The conditions at Homestead do not meet minimum standards required by both U.S. and international law. We cannot allow the Trump Administration to send more children there.
For police officers and for members of the public, reforming our gun laws must be a top priority. We owe it to the American people to take meaningful action to keep them safe and save lives.
We have no time to waste when it comes to fighting the climate crisis. We must #ActOnClimate.
Novartis' AveXis provides yet another example of Big Pharma’s dangerous greed. We must hold Big Pharma accountable for manipulating data and potentially putting patients in harm’s way.
Leader McConnell: call the Senate back in session. The time to vote on gun reform is now.
I am calling on the Senate to pass my Domestic Terrorism Prevention Act right away. We have a moral obligation to do everything we can to fight this scourge of white supremacist violence.
We must take seriously the threat of white supremacist violence and domestic terrorism.
How could the DEA approve ever-increasing quotas and then wonder why the opioid epidemic was growing out of control? It’s up to our government to rein in Big Pharma’s greed.
President Trump’s cruel, anti-immigrant agenda is causing families in Chicago and in cities around the country to live in fear. We must put a stop to this Administration’s inhumanity.
At the same time that President Trump’s family separation policy is creating a humanitarian crisis on the border, he’s now shamefully planning to separate families across the country.
Mass arrests and deportations won’t make our country safer—they will tear apart families and drive fear in our communities. President Trump must reverse his cruel, anti-immigrant agenda.
Happy Independence Day to Illinoisans and Americans all across this nation.

I’m encouraged that the Supreme Court saw the Trump Administration’s citizenship question for what it was: an attempt to undercount our communities and subvert our democratic process.

Ten years without an increase in the minimum wage is downright unacceptable. Millions of Americans are working full-time but still can’t make ends meet. Congress must immediately pass the Raise the Wage Act.
I’m introducing the RISE from Trauma Act in the Senate to help ensure every child who has experienced trauma has the support and resources they need to overcome and thrive.
The American people are counting on us to create jobs and invest in our nation’s infrastructure, but President Trump’s drama and temper tantrums are standing in the way of our progress.
We must fight President Trump’s dangerous moves toward another conflict in the Middle East.
None of us wants to see a replay of the disastrous war with Iraq, which I voted against in 2002. That’s why we should all be outraged about President Trump’s drumbeat of war with Iran.
These efforts across the country to effectively ban all abortion is an attack on women’s rights and an attempt to set the stage for Roe v. Wade to be overturned. We cannot stand for this.
I visited the border and saw firsthand the failures of the Trump Administration’s policies. I’m proud to help offer a better approach to both secure our border and protect asylum seekers.

I have been doing everything I can to fight the rise of youth tobacco use and curb tobacco companies’ predatory practices, like marketing “gummy bear” flavored e-cigarettes to kids. An important step we can take if we want to make it harder for young people to access these harmful tobacco products is to raise the age for smoking and vaping to 21.

Here’s something Republicans and Democrats can agree on -- it’s time for Congress to crack down on the scammers who are pestering Americans with billions of robocalls every year. Millions of vulnerable Americans lost nearly $10 billion to these scammers last year. I introduced the Protecting American Consumers from Robocalls Act to help put a stop to this.
It has become increasingly clear that President Trump is enthralled with authoritarian leaders from countries like Russia, Saudi Arabia, and Brazil. This is not something to take lightly.
Attorney General Barr’s testimony before the Senate Judiciary Committee made it clear that he is not qualified to serve justice on Special Counsel Mueller’s 14 remaining criminal referrals.

The report paints a very different picture than what we’ve heard from the President and the Attorney General. It’s essential that Special Counsel Mueller now testify before Congress. The American people deserve nothing less than full transparency about this critical investigation.
President Trump was wrong to veto our bipartisan resolution to withdraw the U.S. from Yemen. Congress has never authorized our involvement in this Saudi-led humanitarian disaster.

First, Attorney General Barr tried to spin Special Counsel Mueller’s findings with his four-page letter to Congress. Then, he tried again with his pre-report press conference. Enough spin. The report is out and the person we need to hear from most is Special Counsel Mueller himself.

Americans have had enough of skyrocketing drug prices. Thankfully, we have a solution to this growing crisis. I have introduced bipartisan legislation in the Senate like the REMEDY Act, the REFUND Act, and the FLAT Prices Act to help lower prescription drug costs for all Americans.
People’s lives are not a game. For President Trump to threaten to use human beings who come to our border seeking safety and security as political pawns like this is beyond unconscionable.

I have called for Secretary Nielsen’s resignation for months. While I am glad to see the person responsible for separating thousands of children from their families at our border step down, it’s deeply troubling that President Trump wants to appoint someone who will take an even harsher approach to immigration than the unimaginable cruelty we saw under Secretary Nielsen’s watch.

At this critical time, when the Department of Justice faces serious issues ranging from the Mueller report to immigration to prison reform, I do not believe that President Trump’s nominee, Jeffrey Rosen, is qualified to serve as our Deputy Attorney General.
This move by Leader McConnell and the GOP lays bare their true agenda. They want to pack the courts with as many extreme right-wing judges as they can with as little scrutiny as possible.

The north star of our democracy must be ensuring the will of the American people is reflected in the outcome of our Presidential elections. Today, I’m joining colleagues in introducing a constitutional amendment to do away with the Electoral College. The candidate for President who receives the most votes should be elected President. Period.
There should be a complete, unredacted disclosure of the Mueller Report. The American people paid for it, and the American people deserve to know what was found.
Great to be in East St. Louis over the weekend supporting !
The rule changes proposed by the Trump Administration are unfair and could put hundreds of thousands of people in Illinois at risk of losing the SNAP benefits they rely on to put food on the table.
Our hearts break for the lives lost in the New Zealand mosque massacre. We must stand strong against hatred and bigotry against our Muslim brothers and sisters anywhere in the world.

President Trump’s government shutdown was a disaster. His national emergency declaration is on the verge of being reversed by Congress. And now he’s demanding $8.6 billion for the same wasteful, ineffective border wall, while cutting billions from medical research. Ridiculous.

With reports of unacceptably high levels of ethylene oxide emissions at the Sterigenics plant in Willowbrook, Illinois families deserve to know if they’re health is at risk. The EPA must take immediate action to protect our communities.
I’m glad Illinois has joined with 15 other states to sue President Trump over his brazen abuse of power with his unconstitutional emergency declaration over his beloved wall.

President Trump’s emergency declaration is legally and constitutionally dubious -- and while he claims that building his big, beautiful wall will stop the flow of narcotics across the border, Congress just passed a bipartisan compromise that would actually address this problem by providing additional funding for better screening technology and more Customs personnel.  I’m deeply disappointed in President Trump’s continued fear-mongering around immigration, and there’s little doubt in my mind that this power grab will be contested in court immediately.

I joined my colleagues Senator Debbie Stabenow and Senator Tammy Duckworth to introduce a bill that would expand Medicare access to every American over the age of 50. Building on the progress of the Affordable Care Act, this is an important next step toward ensuring every American has the right to health care, not just the privileged few.

The President of the United States is under investigation. Confirming an Attorney General who won’t protect that investigation, and who believes the President’s powers should be unlimited and unchecked, would be a grave mistake. I’ll be voting against Barr’s confirmation.

As the son of an immigrant, it’s truly an honor to return to my role as the highest ranking Democrat on the Senate Judiciary Immigration Subcommittee at a time when ensuring that our immigration laws live up to the promise of our nation has never been more important.
I voted no today on William Barr’s confirmation to become the next Attorney General of the United States. There is too much at stake for an AG in the pocket of the President.
This week, I’ll be introducing the FLAT Prices Act in the Senate because it’s past time we cracked down on price-gouging of life-saving medicines from abusive drug companies.

Reducing gun violence in our communities should be among our top priorities. Because thousands of guns are stolen from gun shops every year, I’m introducing commonsense legislation to ensure that gun dealers are required to properly secure their firearms inventory after hours to help prevent guns from ending up in the hands of dangerous people.

In Illinois, women make only 78 cents for each dollar a man makes, with an even wider gap for women of color. The Paycheck Fairness Act will help our efforts to close the gender pay gap.  We’ve passed several equal pay laws, including the Lilly Ledbetter Act 10 years ago, but our fight to end gender pay inequality is not over. Equal pay for equal work is long overdue.
President Trump’s government shutdown debacle didn’t just hurt federal workers, it is also expected to cost our economy billions of dollars. We simply can’t let this happen again.

One phone call from Majority Leader Mitch McConnell could get the process of ending President Trump’s shutdown started immediately, but so far, he’s refused to allow a vote on the Senate floor. As soon as the government is open again, we can resume the important debate about how to best secure the border. But we absolutely should not continue to allow President Trump to hold our government hostage and harm American families while we have that discussion.
The longer this government shutdown is allowed to continue, the more unconscionable it becomes. This shutdown can end the moment Senate Republicans decide to end it.

President Trump can open the government tomorrow. One phone call from Mitch McConnell can get it started. But it’s clear that we won’t see any progress until Senate Republicans say enough. We can get to work on debating border security after the government is open again.
President Trump is holding federal workers’ paychecks hostage and it’s downright cruel. There is no reason for this shutdown to continue. It’s time to get our government back to work.
